intro: Marlieriopsis, commonly known as the golden star fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its striking, yellowish-bronze inflorescence, which resembles a star and is highly ornamental. Marlieriopsis species typically grow as epiphytes or lithophytes, often found on trees or rocks in humid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a sought-after plant in horticulture and botanical collections.
